body: BOONE, Iowa – Donald Trump zeroed in Saturday on Republican rival Ben Carson, questioning whether he has the energy to be president, a line he has frequently used to taunt Jeb Bush. "I don't think Ben has the energy," said Trump, before calling him a "nice man" and arguing that he is not cut out for negotiating with some foreign officials. The attack came as Carson, a retired surgeon running an outsider campaign like Trump, has surged into second place in many surveys, behind the brash real estate mogul. Trump, who campaigned here before heading to a tailgate party where a trio of other GOP hopefuls were also appearing, also criticized Carson for recently questioning his Christian faith. "You don't hit a person on faith," said Trump. "I don't know him. He knows nothing about me." But Trump commended Carson for apologizing to him.
description: Attack came as retired surgeon surged into second place in many surveys.
title: Trump questions Ben Carson’s ‘energy’ to be president
